title: The_Fantastic_Four:_First_Steps
extract: The Fantastic Four: First Steps is an upcoming American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics superhero team the Fantastic Four. Produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures, it is intended to be the 37th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the second reboot of the Fantastic Four film series. The film is directed by Matt Shakman from a screenplay by the writing team of Jeff Kaplan and Ian Springer, Josh Friedman, Cameron Squires, Eric Pearson, and Peter Cameron. It features an ensemble cast including Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn, and Ebon Moss-Bachrach as the titular team, alongside Ralph Ineson, Julia Garner, Paul Walter Hauser, John Malkovich, Natasha Lyonne, and Sarah Niles. In the film, the Fantastic Four must protect their 1960s-inspired retro-futuristic world from the planet-devouring cosmic being Galactus.
text:
{{Short description|Upcoming Marvel Studios film<!-- Per consensus at WP:MCU. -->}}

Its logo appearing does not confirm otherwise. See [[Talk:Deadpool & Wolverine#FAQ]] for more. -->

'''''The Fantastic Four: First Steps'''''<!--Do not add stylization here as the number "4" being used is not different enough. See talk for more.--> is an upcoming American [[superhero film]] based on the [[Marvel Comics]] superhero team the [[Fantastic Four]]. Produced by [[Marvel Studios]] and distributed by [[Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures]], it is intended to be [[List of Marvel Cinematic Universe films|the 37th film]] in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) and the second [[Reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the [[Fantastic Four in film|''Fantastic Four'' film series]]. The film is directed by [[Matt Shakman]] from a screenplay by the writing team of Jeff Kaplan and Ian Springer, [[Josh Friedman]], Cameron Squires, [[Eric Pearson]], and Peter Cameron. It features an [[ensemble cast]] including [[Pedro Pascal]], [[Vanessa Kirby]], [[Joseph Quinn]], and [[Ebon Moss-Bachrach]] as [[Fantastic Four (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|the titular team]], alongside [[Ralph Ineson]], [[Julia Garner]], [[Paul Walter Hauser]], [[John Malkovich]], [[Natasha Lyonne]], and [[Sarah Niles]].<!-- Order per "ProjectProfile" --> In the film, the Fantastic Four must protect their 1960s-inspired [[Retrofuturism|retro-futuristic]] world from the planet-devouring cosmic being [[Galactus (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Galactus]].

[[20th Century Fox]] began work on a new Fantastic Four film following the failure of ''[[Fantastic Four (2015 film)|Fantastic Four]]'' (2015). After the studio was [[Acquisition of 21st Century Fox by Disney|acquired by Disney]] in March 2019, control of the franchise was transferred to Marvel Studios and a new film was announced that July. [[Jon Watts]] was set as director in December 2020, but stepped down in April 2022. Shakman replaced him that September when Kaplan and Springer were working on the script. Casting was underway by early 2023, and Friedman joined to rewrite the script in March, with Squires and Cameron also writing. Marvel Studios wanted to tell a new story with the characters rather than retell their [[origin story]]. Pearson joined to polish the script by mid-February 2024, when the main cast was announced. Filming occurred from July to November 2024 at [[Pinewood Studios]] in London, and on location in England and Spain.

''The Fantastic Four: First Steps'' is scheduled to be released in the United States on July 25, 2025, as the first film, and beginning, of [[Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Six|Phase Six]] of the MCU.

== Premise ==
On a 1960s-inspired [[Retrofuturism|retro-futuristic]] Earth, the [[Fantastic Four (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Fantastic Four]] must protect their world from the planet-devouring cosmic being [[Galactus (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Galactus]] and his herald, the [[Shalla-Bal (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Silver Surfer]].<ref name="ProjectProfile" />

== Cast ==
<!-- Order per "ProjectProfile" -->
* [[Pedro Pascal]] as [[Reed Richards (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Reed Richards / Mister Fantastic]]: A highly intelligent scientist and the leader of the [[Fantastic Four (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Fantastic Four]] who can stretch any part of his body to great lengths<ref name="CastConfirm" />
* [[Vanessa Kirby]] as [[Sue Storm (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Sue Storm / Invisible Woman]]: Johnny's sister and a member of the Fantastic Four w

title: Brian_Murphy_(actor)
extract: Brian Trevor John Murphy was an English comic actor. He was best known as the henpecked husband George Roper in the popular sitcom Man About the House and its spin-off series George and Mildred. He also played Alvin Smedley in Last of the Summer Wine. Other notable roles included Stan the shopkeeper in the 1990s children's series Wizadora, and Maurice in the comedy drama series The Booze Cruise.
trending_reason: The article for Brian Murphy is likely trending on Wikipedia following his recent passing on February 2, 2025, which has prompted renewed interest in his contributions to British comedy and television.

title: Linda_Regan
extract: Linda Regan, born Linda Mary Drinkwater, is a British actress and author, who has appeared on television, film, radio and on stage. She is best known for her role as yellowcoat April Wingate in the British holiday camp sitcom Hi-de-Hi!.
text:
{{Short description|British actress and author (born 1949)}}
{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2025}}
{{Infobox person
| name        = Linda Regan
| imagesize   =
| caption     =
| birth_date  = {{Birth date and age|1949|11|5|df=yes}}
| birth_place = [[Brixton]], London<ref name="freeBMD" />
| birth_name  = Linda Mary Drinkwater
| occupation  = Actress
| website     = {{URL|lindareganonline.co.uk}}
| yearsactive = 1970–present
| spouse      = {{marriage|[[Brian Murphy (actor)|Brian Murphy]]|1995|2025|end=died}}
| relatives   = [[Carol Drinkwater]] (sister)<ref name="Independent" />
}}
'''Linda Regan''' (born 5 November 1949),<ref name="IMDB" /,<ref name="Endole" /> born '''Linda Mary Drinkwater''', is a [[British people|British]] actress and author, who has appeared on television, film, radio and on stage. She is best known for her role as yellowcoat April Wingate in the British holiday camp sitcom ''[[Hi-de-Hi!]]''.

==Early life==
Born in [[Brixton]], London,  Regan is a daughter of bandleader and agent Peter Regan (born Peter Albert Drinkwater) and Phyllis McCormack, an Irish nurse; Regan's older sister is the actress and writer [[Carol Drinkwater]].<ref name="Hammer_Complete" /><ref name="Independent" /> They moved to [[Rochester, Kent|Rochester]], before settling in [[Bromley]] when Regan was five. Regan often helped her father while entertaining, such as helping with [[Punch and Judy]] and balloon modelling. After leaving school, Regan attended the [[Worcester Repertory Company]].<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=https://www.kent-life.co.uk/people/celebrity-interviews/bromley-star-linda-regan-murphy-1-4283516|title=Bromley star Linda Regan-Murphy|first=Sarah|last=Sturt|website=Kent Life}}</ref>

==Career==
{{BLP sources|date=June 2020}}
Regan made her television debut in 1970, in an episode of the [[ITV (TV channel)|ITV]] [[sitcom]] ''[[On the Buses]]''.  Shortly after, she appeared in [[On the Buses (film)|the film version of the same name]]. This was followed by roles in well known programmes such as ''[[Doctor at Large (TV series)|Doctor at Large]]'', ''[[Softly, Softly: Task Force]]'', ''[[Special Branch (TV series)|Special Branch]]'' and ''[[Dixon of Dock Green]]''. She was also the stunt double for [[Katy Manning]]'s [[Jo Grant]] in the ''[[Doctor Who]]'' episode "[[Carnival of Monsters]]" in 1973.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://guide.doctorwhonews.net/person.php?code=6525|title=Doctor Who Guide: Linda Regan|author=Doctor Who Guide|publisher=Doctor Who Guide}}</ref> In the mid-1970s, Regan appeared in several [[sex comedy]] films including ''[[Carry On England]]'', ''[[Confessions of a Pop Performer]]'' and ''[[Adventures of a Private Eye]]''. She also appeared in the high-profile films ''[[A Private Enterprise]]'' (1974), ''[[The Hiding Place (film)|The Hiding Place]]'' (1975) and ''[[Quadrophenia (film)|Quadrophenia]]'' (1979) and had a main role in the hospital drama ''[[General Hospital (British TV series)|General Hospital]]'' from 1976 to 1977. Regan appeared in the first episode of popular drama series ''[[Minder (TV series)|Minder]]'' in 1979 starring [[George Cole (actor)|George Cole]] and [[Dennis Waterman]] and played a Swedish pop star in ''[[Bergerac (TV series)|Bergerac]]'', before having a role in the film ''[[The Hit (1984 film)|The Hit]]'' (1984) with [[John Hurt]] and [[Terence Stamp]]. She followed this with a main role in the [[holiday camp]] sitcom ''[[Hi-de-Hi!]]'' as April, a character she would play from 1984 until the show's end in 1988, appearing in a total of twenty-four episodes.

After appearances in ''[[Birds of a Feather (TV series)|Birds of a Feather]]'', thriller ''[[Framed (TV series)|Framed]]'' and hard hitting crime drama ''[[The Knock]]'', Regan starred in five episodes of ''[[The Bill]]'' before appearing as Harry's mother in all 4 series of children's drama series ''[[Harry and Cosh]]'' from 1999 to 2003. She continues her career on both stage and screen, including ''[[Holby City]]'', ''[[Doctors (2000 TV series)|Doctors]]'' and ''[[Run for Your Wife (2012 film)|Run for Your Wife]]'', as well as appearing in several short films and commercials, and writing award-winning crime novels.<ref name="Hammer_Complete" />
Regan was in two episodes of podcast sitcom [[Barmy Dale]] in 2023 and played alongside her husband [[Brian Murphy (actor)|Brian Murphy]] as the mayor of Barmy Dale Felicity Palmer{{fact|date=January 2025}}.

==Personal life==
Regan married the actor [[Brian Murphy (actor)|Brian Murphy]] in 1995.<ref name="BBC" />

She is [[dyslexic]] and was not encouraged at school but wrote stories from a young age. Just before her first book was published, in 2005, she was kidnapped at knifepoint and forced into a car, later jumping from the vehicle to escape. Soon after, she was diagnosed with cancer, which she believes was caused by her kidnap ordeal; she overcame the disease.<ref name="auto"/>

A dog lover since childhood, Regan runs her own blog in which she communica

title: Kelsea_Ballerini

title: Troy_Selwood
extract: Troy Selwood was an Australian rules footballer who played 75 games for the Brisbane Lions in the Australian Football League (AFL). He was also captain of the Geelong Football Club's team in the Victorian Football League (VFL) from 2011 to 2013.
text:
{{Short description|Australian rules footballer (1984–2025)}}
{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}}
{{Use Australian English|date=September 2015}}

| name = Troy Selwood

| fullname = Troy Selwood
| nickname =

'''Troy Selwood''' (1 May 1984 – 4 February 2025) was an [[Australian rules football]]er who played 75 games for the [[Brisbane Lions]] in the [[Australian Football League]] (AFL). He was also captain of the Geelong Football Club's team in the [[Victorian Football League]] (VFL) from 2011 to 2013.

==AFL career==
Selwood was drafted by the [[Brisbane Lions]] with the number 19 pick in the [[2002 AFL draft]] from [[Sandhurst Football Club|Sandhurst]]. After not playing in 2003 or 2004, he made his AFL debut for the Lions wearing the number 28 guernsey in Round 1, [[2005 AFL season|2005]], against [[St Kilda Football Club|St Kilda]]. His endurance and accountable style of play saw him mainly utilised in a tagging role on key opposition players.

On 9 May 2009, Selwood was knocked unconscious in a collision with [[Richmond Football Club|Richmond]]'s [[Alex Rance]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Alex Rance and Troy Selwood knock each other out - 2009 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OnZI1Ir4aZc |website=YouTube |publisher=SR B |access-date=18 August 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/sport/afl/voss-pays-tribute-to-selwood/story-e6freck3-1225710870331 |title=Voss pays tribute to Troy Selwood |work=[[Adelaide Now]] |date=10 May 2009 |access-date=18 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111007035345/http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/sport/afl/voss-pays-tribute-to-selwood/story-e6freck3-1225710870331 |archive-date=7 October 2011 |url-status=dead}}</ref>

Selwood was delisted by the Brisbane Lions at the end of the 2010 season.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |date=2025-02-04 |title=Family 'heartbroken' by sudden death of former AFL player Troy Selwood |url=https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-02-04/former-afl-player-troy-selwood-dies-aged-40/104894736 |access-date=2025-02-04 |work=ABC News |language=en-AU}}</ref>

==VFL career==
On 1 October 2010, Selwood was rumoured to be moving back to his home state of Victoria and to the [[Geelong Football Club]] in the hope of resurrecting his AFL career. It was suggested that Selwood would juggle completing his [[commerce]] degree while also working for Geelong and playing for the Cats in the VFL. He hoped to play AFL in season 2012.<ref>{{cite news |last=Sheahan |first=Mike |author-link=Mike Sheahan |date=1 October 2010 |title=Another Selwood joins Cats |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/sport/afl/another-selwood-joins-cats/story-e6frf9jf-1225932892056 |access-date=10 December 2010 |newspaper=Herald Sun}}</ref> He was appointed co-captain of the Geelong VFL side at the beginning of the 2011 season.<ref>{{cite web|last=Carty|first=Daniel|title=VFL: Cats down to Scorpions (report)|url=http://www.geelongcats.com.au/geelongnews/newsarticle/tabid/3933/newsid/110514/default.aspx|publisher=Geelong Football Club|access-date=19 June 2011|date=3 April 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725074852/http://www.geelongcats.com.au/geelongnews/newsarticle/tabid/3933/newsid/110514/default.aspx|archive-date=25 July 2011|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

On 23 September 2012, Selwood led the Geelong Cats' VFL side to a premiership, defeating Port Melbourne by 33 points at Docklands Stadium in Melbourne. He retired from VFL football at the end of the [[2013 VFL season|2013 season]].<ref name=":0"/><ref>[http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/sport/cats-vfl-premiership-captain-troy-selwood-retires-with-no-regrets/story-fnjuhrhu-1226765438238 Cats VFL premiership captain Troy Selwood retires with no regrets]</ref>

==Personal life and death==
A member of the Selwood family from [[Bendigo]] in central Victoria, Selwood had three brothers: [[twin]] brother [[Adam Selwood|Adam]] (who played for {{AFL|WC}}), and younger brothers [[Joel Selwood|Joel]] and [[Scott Selwood|Scott]] (who both played for {{AFL Gee}}).<ref name="TA-20070615">{{cite web |url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/sport/paddle-pops-out-jeff-goes-for-the-doctor/2007/06/14/1181414463795.html |title=Paddle Pops out, Jeff goes for the doctor |work=[[The Age]] |date=15 June 2007 |access-date=21 March 2008 |author=McClure, Geoff |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181216032216/http://www.theage.com.au/news

title: This_Is_America_(song)
extract: "This Is America" is a song by American rapper Childish Gambino. Written by Gambino, Ludwig Göransson, & fellow American rapper Young Thug and produced by the former two, it was released on May 6, 2018, at the same time that Gambino was hosting an episode of Saturday Night Live. The song also features backing vocals from fellow American rappers Slim Jxmmi of Rae Sremmurd, BlocBoy JB, Quavo, and 21 Savage. The lyrics and accompanying music video, reflecting the core of the Black Lives Matter movement, confront issues of ongoing systemic racism, including prejudice, racial violence, the ghetto, and law enforcement in the United States, as well as the wider issues of mass shootings and gun violence in the United States.
trending_reason: The *This Is America* article is likely trending on Wikipedia due to renewed discussions and analyses surrounding its themes of systemic racism and gun violence, particularly in light of recent events and ongoing societal issues.

'''Nayib Armando Bukele Ortez''' ({{IPA|es|naˈʝiβ buˈkele|lang}}; born 24 July 1981) is a Salvadoran politician and businessman who has been the 81st and current [[president of El Salvador]] since 1 June 2019.

Bukele established an advertising company in 1999 and worked at an advertising company owned by his father, [[Armando Bukele Kattán]]; both companies advertised election campaigns for the [[Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front]] (FMLN) political party. Bukele entered politics in 2011; the following year, he joined the FMLN and was elected mayor of [[Nuevo Cuscatlán]]. Bukele served until his 2015 election as [[mayor of San Salvador]], where he served until 2018. In 2017, Bukele was ousted from the FMLN; he founded the [[Nuevas Ideas]] political party shortly afterward and pursued a presidential campaign in [[2019 Salvadoran presidential election|2019]]. After the [[Supreme Electoral Court (El Salvador)|Supreme Electoral Court]] (TSE) refused to register his party, Bukele ran for president with the [[Grand Alliance for National Unity]] (GANA) and won with 53 percent of the vote.

Bukele implemented the [[Territorial Control Plan]] in July 2019 to reduce El Salvador's 2019 [[homicide]] rate of 38 per 100,000 people. Homicides fell by 50 percent during Bukele's first year in office following a trending decline that began in 2016; Bukele attributed the homicide decrease to the plan. Digital ne

title: Vanessa_Kirby
extract: Vanessa Nuala Kirby is an English actress. She made her professional acting debut on stage, with acclaimed performances in the plays All My Sons (2010), A Midsummer Night's Dream (2010), Women Beware Women (2011), Three Sisters (2012), and as Stella Kowalski in A Streetcar Named Desire (2014).
text:
{{Short description|British actress (born 1987 or 1988)}} {{Use British English|date=September 2020}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2023}} {{Infobox person | name = Vanessa Kirby | image = Vanessa Kirby at the 2024 Toronto International Film Festival 08 (Cropped).jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = Kirby at the 2024 [[Toronto International Film Festival]] | birth_name = Vanessa Nuala Kirby | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|4|18}} or
{{birth date and age|1988|4|18}} | birth_place = [[Wimbledon, London|Wimbledon]], London, England | education = [[University of Exeter]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]]) | occupation = Actress | years_active = 2010–present | father = [[Roger Kirby]] | relatives = [[Joe Kirby (teacher)|Joe Kirby]] (brother) }} '''Vanessa Nuala Kirby''' (born 18 April 1987 or 1988){{Efn|While many sources claim her birth year to be 1988, there are numerous sources that match up to 1987 being her birth year. Articles from The Independent and The Guardian in December 2011 list her age as 24.{{cite web|url=https://www.the-independent.com/arts-entertainment/tv/features/vanessa-kirby-a-dickens-leading-lady-with-a-dark-side-6280274.html|last=Mottram|first=James|title=Vanessa Kirby: A Dickens leading lady with a dark side|work=[[The Independent]]|access-date=December 26, 2024|date=December 21, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2011/dec/18/shahesta-shaitly-why-were-watching-vanessa-kirby|last=Shaitly|first=Shahesta|title=Why we're watching....Vanessa Kirby|work=[[The Guardian]]|access-date=December 26, 2024|date=December 17, 2011}} Before her birthday in 2012, an article from Vogue in March of that year also lists her age as 24.{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/five-exciting-women-to-watch-this-spring-on-tv-great-expectations-vanessa-kirby|last=Campion|first=Freddie|title=Five Exciting Women to Watch This Spring on TV: Great Expectations' Vanessa Kirby|work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|access-date=December 26, 2024|date=March 15, 2012}} Articles from Stuff and Chatelaine magazines in December 2017 list her age as 30.{{cite web|url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/tv-radio/99596394/the-crown-vanessa-kirby-reveals-why-princess-margaret-was-so-fascinating|last=Croot|first=James|title=The Crown: Vanessa Kirby reveals why Princess Margaret was so fascinating|work=[[Stuff (company)|Stuff]]|access-date=December 26, 2024|date=December 7, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://chatelaine.com/living/entertainment/vanessa-kirby-the-crown/|last=Collie|first=Meghan|title=‘She’s The Ultimate Cool’: The Crown's Vanessa Kirby On Playing Princess Margaret|work=[[Chatelaine (magazine)|Chatelaine]]|access-date=December 26, 2024|date=December 14, 2017}}|group=note}} is an English actress. She made her professional acting debut on stage, with acclaimed performances in the plays ''[[All My Sons]]'' (2010), ''[[A Midsummer Night's Dream]]'' (2010), ''[[Women Beware Women]]'' (2011), ''[[Three Sisters (play)|Three Sisters]]'' (2012), and as [[Stella Kowalski]] in ''[[A Streetcar Named Desire]]'' (2014). Kirby rose to international prominence with her portrayal of [[Princess Margaret, Countess of Snowdon|Princess Margaret]] in the [[Netflix]] drama series ''[[The Crown (TV series)|The Crown]]'' (2016–2017), for which she won the [[British Academy Television Award for Best Supporting Actress]]. She also took on roles in the action films ''[[Hobbs & Shaw]]'' (2019) and the [[Mission: Impossible (film series)|''Mission: Impossible'' film series]] since 2018. For her performance as a grief-stricken woman in ''[[Pieces of a Woman]]'' (2020), she won the [[Volpi Cup for Best Actress]], and received a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Actress]]. Kirby has since portrayed [[Joséphine de Beauharnais|Empress Joséphine]] in the historical drama ''[[Napoleon (2023 film)|Napoleon]]'' (2023). == Life == === Education and family === Kirby was raised in [[Wimbledon, London|Wimbledon]], London.{{cite news |title=10 Things You Never Knew About Vanessa Kirby |url= https://www.bbcamerica.com/blogs/10-things-you-never-knew-about-vanessa-kirby--1015721 |work= bbcamerica.com|date=8 January 2021 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20211123164818/https://www.bbcamerica.com/blogs/10-things-you-never-knew-about-vanessa-kirby--1015721 |url-status=dead |archive-date=November 23, 2021}} Her parents are Jane Kirby, a former ''[[Country Living]]'' magazine writer, and [[Roger Kirby]], a retired surgeon and President of the [[Royal Society of Medicine]]. She has two siblings: [[Joe Kirby (teacher)|Joe]], a school teacher, and Juliet, a theatrical agent.{{Cite web|url= http://ww
trending_reason: The Vanessa Kirby article is likely trending on Wikipedia due to her recent prominent role as Empress Joséphine in the 2023 film *Napoleon*, which has drawn significant media attention and acclaim for her performance.

news_relation:
Vanessa Kirby is making headlines due to her role as Sue Storm in the upcoming "Fantastic Four" film, highlighted by the recent trailer launch.
  • Vanessa Kirby, 'Mission Impossible' and 'The Crown' star, makes MCU debut in 'Fantastic Four' Oscar-nominated actress Vanessa Kirby, known for her performances in Netflix's "The Crown" as well as the "Mission: Impossible" and "Fast & Furious"...
  • Who Is Vanessa Kirby And Where Have We Seen Her? This morning, Marvel debuted its Fantastic Four trailer, giving us our first look at Pedro Pascal as Reed Richards, Joseph Quinn as Johnny Storm,...
  • Vanessa Kirby Wore Atelier Versace To ‘The Fantastic Four: First Steps’ Trailer Launch Vanessa Kirby brings Sue Storm energy in archival Atelier Versace.
